creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: Wide foot with a very long stem, thinner in the center; round bowl with 2 vertically placed attached ring handles; round lid with 3 protruding prongs on top; incised decorations overall
text: Distinguished by its attenuated profile, the deep bowl of this food offering vessel is set on a high foot with matching cover to form a sphere. The upper half has three slender faceted projections to serve as tripod legs when the cover is inverted for use as a bowl. All elements are decorated with fine linear scroll motifs, fretwork patterns, and triangular panels that vaguely recall earlier bronze styles and motifs. With the dispersal of wealth and political authority during late Zhou, the number of local foundries increased and workshops developed regional styles. Eclecticism was a hallmark of the era, and artisans looked to their own past in reviving certain elements of zoomorphic décor like the cicada-inspired triangle panels seen here. A similar <I>dou<I> to this one was discovered in the Warring States tomb at Tongxian near Beijing in 1981. Another related vessel was discovered in 1959 in Huairou county north of Beijing.
title: Food vessel dou
